attributes.comment:
Bureaucracies all over the world have learned that they can make money off of adoptions. As a
result they have instituted extensive fees, some legitimate and some often nothing more than graft.
The result is fewer adoptions. Why increase fees and reduce the incentive to find homes for
children who need them? Instead of putting barriers in the way of adoptions, we should be finding
ways to facilitate adoptions. We should lead the way be keeping adoption costs to a minimum.

Please do not raise the fees for adoptions. If you must raise fees to help pay for costs, please be
as frugal as possible. My sense is that a 66% increase in fees means that this is much more than
a "cost of living" increase. I understand that the current political climate is pay as you go, but
some services such as adoptions should be subsidized as much as possible.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Shawn P. Johansen
